title: Montreal Canadiens - Team Stick Checks Analysis 2024-2025
description: Measures Montreal's skill-based defensive engagement and successful stick work across all three zones
hockey_context: Skill-Based Defensive Stick Work Stick checks are precise defensive plays where Montreal players use their stick to disrupt opponent puck handling, break up passes, or force turnovers through active stick work. These require excellent timing, positioning, and stick skills rather than physical contact. Successful stick checks demonstrate defensive hockey IQ and technical proficiency in disrupting plays without body contact. IMPORTANT NOTE: These stick checks are ONLY counted when they result in a change of puck possession. Stick checks that simply disrupt a play, slow an opponent, or break up a pass without creating a turnover are NOT included in this data. These metrics measure EFFECTIVE stick work that directly creates possession changes for Montreal, not just defensive contact or disruption.
common_situations: Poke checks to strip pucks from opponent stick handling in tight spaces
Stick lifts to disrupt opponent shots, passes, or puck control
Active stick positioning to intercept passes and deflect pucks
Defensive zone stick work to break up cycles and regain possession
Neutral zone stick checks to create transition opportunities
Forechecking stick pressure to force turnovers in offensive zone

key_metrics_explained.OZ Stick Checks: Skill-based turnovers in opponent territory (active forechecking, puck disruption)
key_metrics_explained.DZ Stick Checks: Home zone stick work (breaking up cycles, intercepting passes, defensive positioning)
key_metrics_explained.NZ Stick Checks: Neutral zone stick-on-stick plays (transition defense, pass interruption, gap control)
key_metrics_explained.Total Stick Checks: Combined skill-based possession creation across all zones (higher = more effective stick work)
